headline: Arsenal ‘very advanced’ on Man Utd hijack as agent works with Gunners to ‘speed up’ striker signing
body: Arsenal are in “very advanced” negotiations with Viktor Gyokeres’ representatives as they look to beat Manchester United in the race to sign the striker.
The Gunners desperately need to sign a new striker as their failures in the transfer market in recent windows held them back during the 2024/25 campaign.
Injuries to Kai Havertz and Gabriel Jesus left Mikel Arteta without a recognised striker and Arsenal’s hierarchy are keen to avoid a repeat of this situation next season.
Arsenal have been linked with several potential targets, but Gyokeres and RB Leipzig’s Benjamin Sesko appear to be their preferred options.

Gyokeres has cemented himself as Europe’s most prolific striker at Sporting Lisbon, scoring 54 goals in all competitions during the 2024/25 campaign to become a candidate to be this year’s leading scorer across the top ten divisions.
READ: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd target cheap midfielder, Sporting firm on Gyokeres
Sesko is another long-term Arsenal target as he’s one of the standout young strikers in Europe after his 21-goal campaign for RB Leipzig.
Recent reports have indicated that the Gunners are leaning towards signing Sesko, but one issue is said to be ‘jeopardising’ a potential switch to the Emirates.

It’s unclear whether this has altered Arsenal’s stance on their preferred striker signing, but a report from Portuguese journalist Nuno Farinha on Wednesday claimed they are ‘very advanced’ in talks to sign Gyokeres and a new ‘meeting’ has taken place as the two sides look to thrash out a deal.
Man Utd are also pursuing Gyokeres, with a report claiming they ‘would like’ him over a pricey alternative, but Farinha claims the Sporting Lisbon star has always “desired” a move to Arsenal.

MORE ARSENAL COVERAGE ON F365…

Farinha revealed: “The talks with Arsenal are not new but they have now become more formal since the Gyökeres situation became the situation it was.

“The meeting is currently taking place. Gyökeres’ agent is currently meeting with the owners of Arsenal to try to speed up this process. I don’t know exactly what the amounts are or what amounts are on the table.
“Arsenal is the club that Gyökeres has wanted from the very beginning. Gyökeres wants to play for Arsenal, that’s his desire. He was very open about it to his agent.

“No formal proposal has arrived at Sporting. This time it seems that there will be, because things with Arsenal are already very advanced and it seems to me that there is a great desire to speed up this process. That is why a meeting is taking place at this moment.

“I believe it is in London, which is why I mentioned the issue of British punctuality. Basically, what is important from now on is to understand how this meeting went and how Arsenal will prepare for what we already know is Sporting’s position. €60m plus €10m is out of the question.”
According to reports, Manchester United target Viktor Gyokeres has decided to ‘go on strike’ as he looks to secure a big move elsewhere this summer.
Man Utd legend Rio Ferdinand insists that Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres is not “the guy” to score goals for the Red Devils next season.
Manchester United have reportedly joined a pair of rival sides in pursuit of an expensive striker, but they “would like” to sign a cheaper option if possible.
Benjamin Sesko is ‘worried’ by Arsenal interest in Viktor Gyokeres as RB Leipzig continue to make a deal difficult, according to reports.
According to reports, Manchester United are at risk of being hijacked in the race to sign Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres after a ‘direct call’.
Man Utd have initiated “new contacts” as they “call again” to get a deal for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres over the line, according to reports.

headline: Man Utd: Viktor Gyokeres to ‘go on strike’ to force transfer; ‘won’t play again’ amid broken ‘promise’
body: According to reports, Manchester United target Viktor Gyokeres has decided to ‘go on strike’ as he looks to secure a big move elsewhere this summer.
Gyokeres is highly sought after as he scored 54 goals in all competitions for Sporting Lisbon during the 2024/25 campaign to cement himself as a frontrunner to be this year’s top scorer in 2025.
Man Utd are known to be in the market for a striker and Gyokeres is among their leading targets after missing out on Liam Delap, who decided to join Chelsea.

It was feared that United’s failure to qualify for Europe could impact their hopes of landing their preferred summer targets. However, Bryan Mbuemo looks likely to follow Matheus Cunha in signing for the Premier League giants, and Gyokeres could be next.
Gyokeres has a strong relationship with United head coach Ruben Amorim after they worked together at Sporting Lisbon and it’s been reported that he is ‘very keen’ to join the Red Devils.
READ: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd target cheap midfielder, Sporting firm on Gyokeres
There is competition for Gyokeres, but the striker seemingly hoped for an undramatic exit negotiation as he’s been widely reported to have come to a ‘gentleman’s agreement’ with Sporting Lisbon.
He has a 100 million euro release clause in his agreement, but this supposed agreement stipulates that he could leave for a reduced fee of around 70 million euros.
However, a recent report revealed Gyokeres is ‘furious’ as Sporting Lisbon have broken this ‘promise’ as this ‘agreement’ is void as they demand a higher fee.

Now, a report from Portuguese outfit Record claims Gyokeres is taking drastic action to secure a move elsewhere as he has decided to ‘go on strike’ and has informed the Primeira Liga champions that he ‘will not play for them again’ as he ‘feels let down’.
It remains to be seen whether this will impact Man Utd’s hopes of landing Gyokeres, but Fabrizio Romano has provided an update on their move for the forward.

He explained: “Man Utd have called last week, have called over the weekend, and have called again this week for Gyokeres to be informed about the player, to understand the conditions, to understand what’s going on with Sporting, to understand if there is still a chance to make it happen financially after not making it into Champions League.

“Man Utd have been in active talks for Gyokeres in terms of understanding the situation, not club-to-club talks. There is no bid from Man Utd as of this afternoon. We will see in the next days, but for sure, this tense situation between Gyokeres and Sporting is an important point of the story.

“And remember that he remains also on Arsenal’s list in case the [Benjamin] Sesko deal doesn’t happen. But for Sesko, the conversations are ongoing, advancing. Sesko remains the priority, but Gyokeres is still on Arsenal’s list in case that deal doesn’t happen.”
Man Utd have submitted an offer to sign Viktor Gyokeres as they look to beat Arsenal in the race for the Sporting CP striker, according to reports.
Arsenal are in “very advanced” negotiations with Viktor Gyokeres’ representatives as they look to beat Manchester United in the race to sign the striker.
Man Utd legend Rio Ferdinand insists that Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres is not “the guy” to score goals for the Red Devils next season.
Manchester United have reportedly joined a pair of rival sides in pursuit of an expensive striker, but they “would like” to sign a cheaper option if possible.
Benjamin Sesko is ‘worried’ by Arsenal interest in Viktor Gyokeres as RB Leipzig continue to make a deal difficult, according to reports.
According to reports, Manchester United are at risk of being hijacked in the race to sign Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres after a ‘direct call’.

headline: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd target cheap midfielder, Sporting firm on Gyokeres
body: There’s a new entry with Manchester United linked with a Championship-bound midfielder, while the Viktor Gyokeres pursuit threatens to get messy…
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to becoming done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) Hugo Ekitike – Eintracht Frankfurt to Chelsea
You could substitute Chelsea for Liverpool at any point here while discussing the rumours around Ekitike. Both clubs are interested but each have the same problem: Eintracht Frankfurt and their insistence on £85million.

19) 🔽 Mike Maignan – AC Milan to Chelsea
Chelsea are being weird here. They wanted Maignan in for the Club World Cup but refused to pay more than £10-12million, only just over half the price Milan want to sell the France no.1. Now the Blues can’t take him to USA, they don’t want him at all. That makes such little sense that it probably isn’t as dead as Chelsea want us to believe.

18) 🆕 Victor Osimhen – Napoli to Manchester United
Osimhen apparently fancies a move to Old Trafford, presumably because he’s seen the salaries United have been dishing out in recent years. Napoli want around £70million, though they may take Joshua Zirkzee in part-exchange. This one doesn’t pass the sniff test, unless we get to late in the window with all parties in the same position they are now.

16) 🆕 Jack Grealish – Manchester City to Bayer Leverkusen
There was talk of interest from Newcastle, which was a move we could really get on board with. But a loan with a £67milion obligation always seemed a little fanciful on City’s part. A £40million deal to replace Florian Wirtz at Leverkusen seems more like the kind of fee City would take for a player with no future under Guardiola, but we’d still rather Grealish stuck around in the Premier League.

MORE ON THE SUMMER 2025 TRANSFER WINDOW
👉 Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
👉 Twenty biggest transfers in the world in 2025 summer transfer window
👉 Wirtz next? The last five times every Premier League club broke transfer record

15) 🔽 Jamie Gittens – Borussia Dortmund to Chelsea
Chelsea’s improved offer has been swiftly rejected. This is not happening…yet.
MORE: Top 10 wingers available this summer features Arsenal, Liverpool targets and Man Utd outcast

14) 🔼 Heung-min Son – Tottenham Hotspur to Al-Hilal
The Saudi Arabian club are desperate to make a statement signing and the Spurs captain could be perfect. He’s out of contract next summer, and Son admitted on Tuesday that his future is far from certain.

13) Luis Diaz – Liverpool to Barcelona
Our reading on this: Barca want Diaz, who would be happy to move to the Nou Camp. Liverpool might be interested in a deal, but only on their terms. Which Barca won’t meet, and Diaz knows it so he won’t kick up a fuss – yet. If this is going to happen, someone needs to change tack. Which doesn’t seem likely any time soon.

12) Joao Pedro – Brighton to Newcastle
The Seagulls forward is intent on leaving Brighton to take the next step but apparently, wherever he goes, he wants to be the first choice. Fine, but he won’t get that at Newcastle while Alexander Isak is around. For how long will that be? That is the more pressing concern for Newcastle fans.

11) James Trafford – Burnley to Newcastle
Word is that Newcastle and Burnley are haggling over the price of a deal that Eddie Howe wanted to do a year ago, with the intention of Trafford and Nick Pope slugging it out for the No.1 spot. Which rarely ever works. Or at least that’s what Howe might tell Pope, but if this comes off, the current Toon keeper’s days are numbered. So Pope might be happy to hear that the two clubs are some way off an agreement with Burnley said to be asking for £40million.

10) Antoine Semenyo – Bournemouth to Tottenham Hotspur
The Cherries reportedly want £70m, which feels unrealistic. A transfer still feels inevitable and Man United, Liverpool and Spurs have all been linked and Londoners are the favourites.

9) 🆕 Wilfried Ndidi – Leicester to Manchester United
The Nigeria midfielder has a £9million release clause and United see him as a good value squad addition to bolster their midfield options, especially if they sell Casemiro this summer. Which makes sense. Everton and the Saudis are also sniffing.

8) 🔽 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Arsenal
The Slovenia striker had overtaken Gyokeres as the favourite to fill the gaping chasm in the centre of Arsenal’s attack after much deliberation on the Gunners’ part. But perhaps they hadn’t accounted for how much of a slog it would be to negotiate with RB Leipzig, who are refusing to accept anything under their £70million valuation. As is their right. Especially when Al-Hilal seem keen to cough up if Sesko can be convinced to move to Saudi.

7) Viktor Gyokeres – Sporting to Manchester United
With Arsenal going cold on Gyokeres, there were plenty of reports that the Swede is open to a move to Old Trafford after all. Sporting say they haven’t received any offers and they also insist that reports of a gentleman’s agreement for him to leave for £59million are b*llocks. Which Gyokeres disputes. This could get messy.

6) Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Manchester United
Tottenham’s renewed interest threatened to scupper United’s hopes of landing Mbeumo but even the prospect of following Thomas Frank to Spurs isn’t deterring the forward from pursuing a move to Old Trafford. He’ll get his way ‘soon’, apparently.

5) Kepa Arrizabalaga – Chelsea to Arsenal
This one is moving quick, apparently, with Arsenal aware that the world’s most expensive goalkeeper will cost them just £5million. Interesting one, this. Kepa recovered some credibility on loan at Bournemouth last season and won’t be going to Arsenal just to play second fiddle to David Raya. Bring on the Gunners goalie wars!

4) Martin Zubimendi – Real Sociedad to Arsenal
This one got the ‘Here we go’ treatment over a month ago but then it all went a bit quiet. And then there was talk of Real Madrid sticking their nose in. Fear not, though, Gooners. Ornstein says it’s done.

3) Milos Kerkez – Bournemouth to Liverpool
Word last week was it’s happening. For around £40million. Which represents decent business for both sides. Things have gone a little quiet since while Liverpool pursue Wirtz but seemingly there is nothing or Reds to worry about here.

2) 🔼 Kevin De Bruyne – Manchester City to Napoli
There was a hitch around image rights but that has been resolved and De Bruyne is due in Rome on Thursday to undergo and medical and sign a two-year contract to fulfil his dream of playing with Scott McTominay.

1) 🔼 Florian Wirtz – Bayer Leverkusen to Liverpool
Liverpool will reportedly pay a British record £126.9m for Wirtz. That’s a lot of wonga. Is Rayan Cherki for a quarter of the price the better transfer? It might just be…
👉 Five reasons why Florian Wirtz may not actually be a good signing for Liverpool

headline: Man Utd star ‘tells agent he only wants to play for Barcelona’ as he prepares to ‘reduce his salary’
body: Man Utd forward Marcus Rashford has informed his agent that he doesn’t want to sign for any other club this summer apart from Barcelona.
The Red Devils allowed the England international to sign for Premier League rivals Aston Villa on loan during the January transfer window.

That came after Rashford fell out of favour with Ruben Amorim, who hit out at the Man Utd forward and claimed that he’d rather play his 63-year-old goalkeeper coach, Jorge Vital, over the England star.
His performances for Aston Villa were mainly positive and Rashford is attracting interest again this summer with Barcelona one of the clubs in for the Man Utd academy graduate.
Speaking last month, Barcelona sporting director Deco told the media that he is interested in signing Rashford and Liverpool winger Luis Diaz this summer.
Deco said in May: “We like Luis [Diaz], we like Rashford, and we like other players. When we go to the market, there are names that we know and that could improve the team.”
READ: Top 10 wingers available this summer features Arsenal, Liverpool targets and Man Utd outcast
Transfer expert Fabrizio Romano, also speaking in May, revealed that Barcelona see Rashford as “an option” as he can play in a number of positions.
Romano said last month: “Internally at Barcelona, they still believe that Marcus Rashford could be an option for the summer transfer window.

“They believe at Barcelona that Rashford might be available on the market. They believe at Barcelona that Rashford could be a good solution because he can play as a No 9 and play on the wing, so he can help in several positions.

“He’s a player appreciated by those at Barcelona. They already wanted Rashford in January, it didn’t happen because Ansu Fati didn’t leave and so in terms of FFP it was not possible to balance the deal.
“But Marcus Rashford remains in the list of Barcelona and so if Rashford is not staying at Aston Villa we will see what happens. He’s one of the options under consideration at Barcelona.
“Then it will depend on FFP, on deal conditions, on more clubs being keen on the player and on what he decides to do.
“We will see on Rashford’s side, but on club side one of the names being mentioned internally at Barcelona is for sure Marcus Rashford.”
And now reports in Spain claim that Rashford ‘has told his agent that he only wants to play for Barcelona’ and is ‘willing to make a significant financial commitment, and reduce his salary’.
Currently, ‘the only way he can say goodbye is in exchange for a significant fee and a permanent transfer’ but Barcelona ‘aren’t willing’ to pay Man Utd’s asking price of €40m.
